library.name: A Comprehensive Bibliography on Syriac Studies

bib: Rooy, Harry F. van. “The Syro-Hexaplaric Headings of the Psalms in Manuscript 12t3.” Aramaic Studies 3:1 (2005): 109–26.
citation: Harry F. van Rooy, “The Syro-Hexaplaric Headings of the Psalms in Manuscript 12t3,” Aramaic Studies 3:1 (2005): 109–26.

data.title: The Syro-Hexaplaric Headings of the Psalms in Manuscript 12t3
data.abstractNote: he Syriac manuscript 12t3 contains many unique variant readings in the headings of the Psalms. This manuscript contains the text of the Psalms according to the Peshitta, but has variants from the Syro-Hexapla added between the lines. It has the headings of the Syro-Hexapla, in full, not between the lines as is the case for the Psalms themselves. This paper considers the headings in this manuscript on their own, as the headings can in some cases reflect a different tradition from that contained in the Psalms themselves. A survey of the variants in the headings of the Psalms in different manuscripts of the Syro-Hexapla is presented followed by a detailed discussion of the headings in manuscript 12t3. This manuscript contains quite a number of unique variants. Some of the variants show hexaplaric influence, others agree with Aquila and Symmachus and influence from other Syriac traditions of  the headings to the Psalms can also be found.
